etymology.description: 食(shí ‘eat; food’) + 物(wù ‘thing; object’) = edible thing(s).
etymology.interpretation: Names an object by function: things for eating. Used broadly for any edible items, from ingredients to prepared dishes.

parts.english: to eat; food; meal; to feed

examples.chinese: 我们带了一些食物去野餐(我們帶了一些食物去野餐)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen dài le yīxiē shíwù qù yěcān.
examples.english: We brought some food for a picnic.

examples.chinese: 我不吃辣的食物(我不吃辣的食物)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù chī là de shíwù.

examples.chinese: 我买了三样食物(我買了三樣食物)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le sān yàng shíwù.
examples.english: I bought three kinds of food.
